item.description: 61-key USB-MIDI keyboard with faders, knobs, transport buttons, 8 pads and aftertouch. Ideal for use with MainStage.

item.description: 8x8 USB-MIDI clip launch controller. Supplied with carry case.

item.description: Get Sprongled.

item.title: AKG Perception 170
item.description: Cardioid Pencil Condenser Microphones. Light enough to be flown. Matched Pair.

item.title: Audio-Technica PRO44
item.description: Half-space unidirectional condenser boundary microphone. Low-profile design makes it ideal as a float mic for stage shows and conferences. Supplied with detachable TA3F to XLRM cable.

item.title: Behringer ECM8000
item.description: Omnidirectional condenser measurement microphone. Ideal for taking room measurements.

item.title: Behringer UBB1002
item.description: Small-format mixer.

item.title: Beyerdynamic MCE 87N(C)S
item.description: Battery powered condenser shotgun microphone. Supplied with muff, windshield and XLR to jack adapter cable.

item.title: JrF C2 Contact Piezo Mic
item.description: Contact microphone. Terinated to 3.5mm or 1/4" jack and supplied with preamp to XLR P48 or impedence adaptor.

item.title: JrF Hydrophone
item.description: Hydrophone for underwater field recording. Supplied with impedence transformer for XLR connection to recorders.

item.title: Korg G4 Rotary Speaker Pedal
item.description: ‘Leslie’ style rotary speaker simulator. Integrated overdrive.

item.title: Pulse MIC-500LJ Lavalier Mic
item.description: Lavalier mic. Suitable for speech or light singing. Terminates to 3.5mm locking connector (Sennheiser type).

item.title: RED5 Audio RV85
item.description: Hanging ‘choir’ mic. Ideal for boundary/fly usage. Supplied with mini-XLR adapter

item.title: RED5 Audio RVK7 Drum Mic Kit
item.description: 2x Pencil Condensor Mics, 4x Dynamic Snare/Tom Mics, 1x Kick Mic. Supplied in case with mounting hardware.

item.title: Rode NT4
item.description: Matched X-Y Stereo Condensor Microphone. 3.5mm and XLR adapters included. Power by 9V battery (not included) or +48V phantom. Supplied in case.

item.title: Sennheiser MD421-II
item.description: Cardioid dynamic instrument microphone. Supplied with clip in case.

item.title: Sennheiser MD441
item.description: Versatile supercardioid dynamic microphone. Supplied with clip in case. Matched Pair.

item.title: Shure SM57
item.description: Cardioid dynamic instrument microphone. Optional shock mount x1.

item.title: the t.bone EM9900
item.description: Hypercardioid condenser shotgun microphone. Switchable 180 Hz low cut (12dB/ Oct.). Ideal for boundary micing choirs and musical theatre.

item.title: the t.bone GZ 500
item.description: Half-supercardioid boundary layer microphone.

item.title: Theatrical Credits
item.description: I am currently looking forward to sound designing The Metamorphosis at the Pilch Studio and lighting designing a selection of Edinburgh Fringe shows. As Sound Designer Show Director Venue Dates The Tempest Costi Levy Oxford Playhouse Feb 2023 An American in Paris Ollie Kurshid Oxford Playhouse Feb 2023 Jekyll and Hyde Michael Speight Pitt Rivers Museum Nov 2022 SKIN Peter Todd O’Reilly Theatre Oct 2022 UNMADE Georgina Dettmer New Theatre, Oxford tick, tick…BOOM!

item.title: Behringer UMC1820
item.description: USB audio interface. 8x10 Analog I/O with 8 inbuilt preamps. Expandable with S/PDIF and ADAT up to 18x20, for example by connection to an ADA8000.

item.description: 2x4 USB bus-powered audio interface. MIDI I/O.

item.description: Mic pole clamp. More compact alternative to the Hex Clamps.

item.title: Hammond X5
item.description: 1970s combo organ. Two manuals + pedals. Vibrato 1/2/3, Leslie Control, Line Out, Reverb Module. See also: Korg G4.

item.title: HDMI Cable, 15m
item.description: Ideal for reaching HD projectors in small-scale venues.

item.title: Headphone Amplifiers
item.description: Some of my USB audio interfaces can be configured as headphone amplifiers. In this way, it’s possible to get 3-4 channels of headphone amplification (for example, for a small band IEM setup).

item.title: Hosa MIT-129
item.description: Passive impedence transformer. Ideal for use with guitars and piezo mics.

item.title: iRig Pro Duo
item.description: 2x2 USB compact interface with 2 combo preamps, MIDI I/O

item.title: K&M 240/50 'Hex Clamp'
item.description: Hex Clamps. Useful for mounting mics to music stands, booms, bars etc.

item.title: K&M Boom Microphone Stands
item.description: Professional microhpone stand.

item.title: Macbook Pro (2014)
item.description: Various software packages available. Powerful enough for complex QLab Audio stacks. Includes Dante Via and Dante Virtual Soundcard licenses.

item.title: Miniature Mic Tripod
item.description: Ideal for desktop/talkback use, or for kick drum mics. One included with RVK7.

item.title: Minijack cable, M/M
item.description: Standard ‘aux’ style cable.

item.title: Minijack extender cable, M/F
item.description: Aux or headphone extender cable.

item.title: Minijack/headphone splitter cable, M/F
item.description: Splits one headphone output to two headphones. Ideal for IEM distribution.

item.title: Minirig 3
item.description: Rugged battery speaker. Ideal for rehearsals, personal monitoring and special FX. 3.5mm and BT input.

item.title: Radial J48
item.description: Active DI box. Perfect for bass guitars!

item.title: Radial ProAV2
item.description: Stereo Passive DI box. RCA, 3.5mm and 1/4" inputs

item.title: USB GO Box
item.description: 6-button Qlab remote controller. Opt. redundant output for backup computer. Really Really Useful!!

item.description: XLR Cable. Various styles and lengths.

item.title: XLR Snake, 12 way, 10m
item.description: 10m, 12 channel snake.

item.title: XLR Snake, 8 way, 2.5m
item.description: 2.5m, 8 channels. I have two, so they can gang together to make a 5m snake.

item.title: XLR Stagebox, 12 inputs x 4 returns, 30m
item.description: 30m, 12 inputs x 4 returns all on XLR3. See also my digital Tio stagebox.

item.title: XLR3F-XLR5F
item.description: XLR5 to XLR3 convertor. Ideal for interfacing various DMX fixtures with venue patches.

item.title: XLR3M-XLR5M
item.description: XLR5 to XLR3 convertor. Ideal for interfacing various DMX fixtures with venue patches.

item.title: XLRm to TRS Jack Snake, 8 way, 2.5m
item.description: 2.5m, 8 channels. Ideal for breaking out line outputs from audio interfaces.

item.title: Yamaha 01V96i
item.description: Compact but powerful 32-channel, 8-bus, 8-aux digital mixer. 16x16 USB interface. 12 local preamps. Perfect for medium-scale shows, such as garden musicals, black-box shows, musical tours and immersive theatre. Optional Dante card available, allowing expansion using our Tio1608-D.

item.title: Yamaha MY16-AUD Dante I/O Card
item.description: Dante expansion card for the 01V96i.

item.title: Yamaha Tio1608-D
item.description: Perfect as a stagebox or I/O expander with the 01v96i and its MY-AUD Dante card, the Tio1608-D stagebox can add 16 microphone or line-level inputs to a Dante network, as well as 8 returns for monitors, recording and IEM usage. Also works well as an audio interface with Dante Virtual Soundcard. Can be supplied with Cat5e cables of various lengths or a Cat6 drum.

item.title: Zoom H2n
item.description: 2/4-channel handy recorder. X/Y, Mid-Side, 2-channel surround and 4-channel surround.

item.title: Zoom H6
item.description: 6-channel battery-powered recorder. Records to SD cards (not included). X/Y and M/S capsules. Supplied with case and accessories including optional fluffy windshield and remote control.

item.title: Zoom RFX1000
item.description: Digital Reverb and Multi-Effects Processor

item.title: Reviews
item.description: A snapshot of recent praise for my work: The Tempest … sound effects were also dramatic and thrilling. This island certainly was full of strange noises, and it felt like a suitably alien environment for the European castaways. Daily Info An American In Paris The sound … was glorious, of an expansiveness, quality, and scale mostly alien to my experience of student theatre. The Oxford Blue Half Baked I would really like to applaud the sound design … I was convinced at first that someone or something was actually banging on the roof of the theatre â€“ a rather impressive feat.
